text.div:
CapabilityStatementKind

How a capability statement is intended to be used.

This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/capability-statement-kind defines the following codes:

Code Display Definition Comments
instance Instance The CapabilityStatement instance represents the present capabilities of a specific system instance. This is the kind returned by /metadata for a FHIR server end-point.
capability Capability The CapabilityStatement instance represents the capabilities of a system or piece of software, independent of a particular installation. Elements marked as 'optional' represent configurable capabilities
requirements Requirements The CapabilityStatement instance represents a set of requirements for other systems to meet; e.g. as part of an implementation guide or 'request for proposal'.

name: CapabilityStatementKind
title: CapabilityStatementKind
description: How a capability statement is intended to be used.

concept.definition: The CapabilityStatement instance represents the present capabilities of a specific system instance.  This is the kind returned by /metadata for a FHIR server end-point.

concept.definition: The CapabilityStatement instance represents the capabilities of a system or piece of software, independent of a particular installation.
The CapabilityStatement instance represents a set of requirements for other systems to meet; e.g. as part of an implementation guide or 'request for proposal'.
